마법 개요

MAGIC OVERVIEW

A spell is a one-time magical effect. 주문 come in two types: arcane (cast by 음유시인, 소서러, and 마법사) and 신성(cast by 사제, 드루이드, and experienced 성기사 and 레인저). Some spellcasters select their 주문 from a limited list of 주문 known, while others have access to a wide variety of options.

Most spellcasters prepare their 주문 in advance—whether from a spellbook or through devout 기도 and meditation— while some cast 주문 spontaneously without preparation.

Despite these different ways that characters use to learn or prepare their 주문, when it comes to casting them, 주문 are very much alike.

Cutting across the categories of arcane and 신성 주문 are the eight 학파 of magic. These 학파 represent the different ways that 주문 take effect.

주문 시전하기

CASTING SPELLS

Whether a spell is arcane or 신성, and whether a character prepares 주문 in advance or chooses them on the 감지, casting a spell works the same way.

주문 선택하기

CHOOSING A SPELL

First you must choose which spell to cast. If you’re a 사제, 드루이드, experienced 성기사, experienced 레인저, or 마법사, you select from among 주문 prepared earlier in the day and not yet cast (see 마법사 주문 준비 and 신성 주문 준비).

If you’re a 음유시인 or 소서러, you can select any spell you know, provided you are capable of 주문 시전하기 of that 레벨 or higher.

To 주문 시전, you must be able to 말하기(if the spell has a verbal component), gesture (if it has a somatic component), and manipulate the material 구성요소 or focus (if any). Additionally, you must concentrate to 주문 시전.

If a spell has multiple versions, you choose which version to use when you cast it. You don’t have to prepare (or learn, in the case of a 음유시인 or 소서러) a specific version of the spell.

Once you’ve cast a prepared spell, you can’t cast it again until you prepare it again. (If you’ve prepared multiple copies of a single spell, you can cast each copy once.) If you’re a 음유시인 or 소서러, casting a spell counts against your daily limit for 주문 of that spell 레벨, but you can cast the same spell again if you haven’t reached your limit.

집중

CONCENTRATION

To 주문 시전, you must concentrate. If something interrupts your 집중 while you’re casting, you must make a 집중 check or lose the spell. The more distracting the interruption and the higher 레벨 of the spell you are trying to cast, the higher the DC is. If you fail the check, you lose the spell just as if you had cast it to no effect.

Injury: If while trying to 주문 시전 you take 피해, you must make a 집중 check (DC 10 + points of 피해 taken + the 레벨 of the spell you’re casting). If you fail the check, you lose the spell without effect. The interrupting event strikes during spellcasting if it comes between when you start and when you complete a spell (for a spell with a 시전 시간 of 1 full round or more) or if it comes in response to your casting the spell (such as an 공격 of opportunity provoked by the spell or a contingent 공격, such as a readied action).

If you are taking continuous 피해 half 피해 is considered to take place while you are casting a spell. You must make a 집중 check (DC 10 + 1/2 피해 that the continuous source last dealt + 레벨 of the spell you’re casting). If the last 피해 dealt was the last 피해 that the effect could deal then 피해 is over, and it does not 주의산만 you.

Repeated 피해 does not count as continuous 피해.

Spell: If you are affected by a spell while attempting to 주문 시전 of your own, you must make a 집중 check or lose the spell you are casting. If the spell affecting you deals 피해, the DC is 10 + points of 피해 + the 레벨 of the spell you’re casting.

If the spell interferes with you or 주의산만 you in some other way, the DC is the spell’s 내성 굴림 DC + the 레벨 of the spell you’re casting. For a spell with no 내성 굴림, it’s the DC that the spell’s 내성 굴림 would have if a save were allowed.

Grappling or Pinned: The only 주문 you can cast while grappling or pinned are those without somatic 구성요소 and whose material 구성요소(if any) you have in hand. Even so, you must make a 집중 check (DC 20 + 레벨 of the spell you’re casting) or lose the spell.

Vigorous Motion: If you are riding on a moving 탈것 소환, taking a bouncy 탑승 in a wagon, on a small boat in rough water, below-decks in a storm-tossed ship, or simply being jostled in a similar fashion, you must make a 집중 check (DC 10 + 레벨 of the spell you’re casting) or lose the spell.

Violent Motion: If you are on a galloping 말, taking a very rough 탑승 in a wagon, on a small boat in rapids or in a storm, on deck in a storm-tossed ship, or being tossed roughly about in a similar fashion, you must make a 집중 check (DC 15 + 레벨 of the spell you’re casting) or lose the spell.

Violent 날씨: You must make a 집중 check if you try to 주문 시전 in violent 날씨. If you are in a high wind carrying blinding rain or sleet, the DC is 5 + 레벨 of the spell you’re casting. If you are in wind-driven hail, dust, or debris, the DC is 10 + 레벨 of the spell you’re casting. In either case, you lose the spell if you fail 집중 check. If 날씨 is caused by a spell, use the rules in the Spell subsection above.

Casting Defensively: If you want to 주문 시전 without provoking any 기회 공격, you must make a 집중 check (DC 15 + 레벨 of the spell you’re casting) to succeed. You lose the spell if you fail.

Entangled: If you want to 주문 시전 while entangled in a net or by a tanglefoot bag or while you’re affected by a spell with similar effects, you must make a DC 15 집중 check to cast the spell. You lose the spell if you fail.

주문 무효화

COUNTERSPELLS

It is possible to cast any spell as a counterspell. By doing so, you are using the spell’s energy to disrupt the casting of the same spell by another character. Counterspelling works even if one spell is 신성 and the other arcane.

How 주문 무효화 Work: To use a counterspell, you must select an opponent as the target of the counterspell. You do this by choosing 준비 action. In doing so, you elect to wait to complete your action until your opponent tries to 주문 시전. (You may still 이동 your 속도, since 준비 is a standard action.)

If the target of your counterspell tries to 주문 시전, make a 주문학 check (DC 15 + the spell’s 레벨). This check is a free action. If the check succeeds, you correctly 식별 the opponent’s spell and can attempt to counter it. If the check fails, you can’t do either of these things.

To complete the action, you must then cast the correct spell. As a general rule, a spell can only counter itself. If you are able to cast the same spell and you have it prepared (if you prepare 주문), you cast it, altering it slightly to create a counterspell effect. If the target is within 거리, both 주문 automatically negate each other with no other results.

Counterspelling 메타마법 주문: 메타마법 특기 are not taken into account when determining whether a spell can be countered

Specific Exceptions: Some 주문 specifically counter each other, especially when they have diametrically opposed effects.

마법 무효화 as a Counterspell: You can use 마법 무효화 to counterspell another spellcaster, and you don’t need to 식별 the spell he or she is casting. However, 마법 무효화 doesn’t always work as a counterspell (see the spell 묘사).

시전자 레벨

CASTER LEVEL

A spell’s power often depends on its 시전자 레벨, which for most spellcasting characters is equal to your class 레벨 in the class you’re using to cast the spell.

You can 주문 시전 at a lower 시전자 레벨 than normal, but 시전자 레벨 you choose must be high enough for you to cast the spell in question, and all 레벨-dependent features must be based on the same 시전자 레벨.

In the event that a class feature, domain granted power, or other special ability provides an adjustment to your 시전자 레벨, that adjustment applies not only to effects based on 시전자 레벨(such as 거리, 지속시간, and 피해 dealt) but also to your 시전자 레벨 check to overcome your target’s 주문 저항 and to 시전자 레벨 used in dispel checks (both the dispel check and the DC of the check).

주문 실패

SPELL FAILURE

If you ever try to 주문 시전 in 상태이상 where the characteristics of the spell cannot be made to conform, the casting fails and the spell is wasted.

주문 also fail if your 집중 is broken and might fail if you’re wearing 갑옷 while casting a spell with somatic 구성요소.

주문의 결과

THE SPELL’S RESULT

Once you know which creatures (or objects or 범위) are affected, and whether those creatures have made successful 내성 굴림(if any were allowed), you can apply whatever results a spell entails.

특수 주문 효과

SPECIAL SPELL EFFECTS

Many 특수 주문 효과 are handled according to 학파 of 주문 in question Certain other special spell features are found across spell 학파.

공격: Some 주문 설명 refer to attacking. All offensive 전투 actions, even those that don’t 피해 opponents are considered 공격. Attempts to 언데드 퇴치 count as 공격. All 주문 that opponents resist with 내성 굴림, that deal 피해, or that otherwise 해악 or hamper subjects are 공격. 주문 that summon 몬스터 or other allies are not 공격 because 주문 themselves don’t 해악 anyone.

보너스 Types: Usually, 보너스 has a type that indicates how the spell grants 보너스. The important aspect of 보너스 types is that two 보너스 of the same type don’t generally stack. With the exception of 회피 보너스, most circumstance 보너스, and racial 보너스, only the better 보너스 works (see 주문 효과 조합하기, below). The same principle applies to 페널티—a character taking two or more 페널티 of the same type applies only the worst one.

Bringing Back 죽음: Several 주문 have the power to restore slain characters to life.

When a living creature dies, its soul departs its body, leaves 물질 세계, travels through 영적 세계, and goes to abide on the plane where the creature’s deity resides. If the creature did not worship a deity, its soul departs to the plane corresponding to its 성향. Bringing someone back from 죽음 means retrieving his or her soul and returning it to his or her body.

레벨 손실: Any creature brought back to life usually loses one 레벨 of experience. The character’s new XP total is midway between the minimum needed for his or her new (reduced) 레벨 and the minimum needed for the next one. If the character was 1 레벨 at the time of death, he or she loses 2 points of 건강 instead of losing a 레벨.

This 레벨 손실 or 건강 loss cannot be repaired by any mortal means, even 소원 or 기적. A revived character can regain a lost 레벨 by earning XP through further adventuring. A revived character who was 1 레벨 at the time of death can regain lost points of 건강 by improving his or her 건강 score when he or she attains a 레벨 that allows an ability score increase.

Preventing Revivification: Enemies can take steps to make it more difficult for a character to be returned from 죽음. Keeping the body prevents others from using 시체 되살리기 or 부활 to restore the slain character to life. Casting 영혼의 덫 prevents any sort of revivification unless the soul is first released.

Revivification against One’s Will: A soul cannot be returned to life if it does not 소원 to be. A soul knows 이름, 성향, and patron deity (if any) of the character attempting to revive it and may refuse to return on that basis.

주문 효과 조합하기

COMBINING MAGICAL EFFECTS

주문 or magical effects usually work as described, no matter how many other 주문 or magical effects happen to be operating in the same 범위 or on the same recipient. Except in special cases, a spell does not affect the way another spell operates. Whenever a spell has a specific effect on other 주문, the spell 묘사 explains that effect. Several other general rules apply when 주문 or magical effects operate in the same place:

Stacking Effects: 주문 that provide 보너스 or 페널티 on 명중 굴림, 피해 rolls, 내성 굴림, and other attributes usually do not stack with themselves. More generally, two 보너스 of the same type don’t stack even if they come from different 주문(or from effects other than 주문; see 보너스 Types, above).

Different 보너스 이름: 보너스 or 페널티 from two different 주문 stack if the 수정치 are of different types. 보너스 that isn’t named stacks with any 보너스.

Same Effect More than Once in Different 근력: In cases when two or more identical 주문 are operating in the same 범위 or on the same target, but at different 근력, only the best one applies.

Same Effect with Differing Results: The same spell can sometimes produce varying effects if applied to the same recipient more than once. Usually the last spell in the series trumps the others. None of the previous 주문 are actually removed or dispelled, but their effects become irrelevant while the final spell in the series lasts.

One Effect Makes Another Irrelevant: Sometimes, one spell can render a later spell irrelevant. Both 주문 are still active, but one has rendered the other useless in some fashion.

Multiple Mental Control Effects: Sometimes magical effects that establish mental control render each other irrelevant, such as a spell that removes the subjects ability to act. Mental controls that don’t remove the recipient’s ability to act usually do not interfere with each other. If a creature is under the mental control of two or more creatures, it tends to obey each to the best of its ability, and to the extent of the control each effect allows. If the controlled creature receives conflicting orders simultaneously, the competing controllers must make opposed 매력 checks to determine which one the creature obeys.

주문 with Opposite Effects: 주문 with opposite effects apply normally, with all 보너스, 페널티, or changes accruing in the order that they apply. Some 주문 negate or counter each other. This is a special effect that is noted in a spell’s 묘사.

Instantaneous Effects: Two or more 주문 with instantaneous 지속시간 work cumulatively when they affect the same target.

주문 설명

SPELL DESCRIPTIONS

묘사 of each spell is presented in a standard format. Each category of information is explained and defined below.

이름

NAME

The first line of every spell 묘사 gives 이름 by which the spell is generally known.

학파(하위학파)

SCHOOL (SUBSCHOOL)

Beneath the spell 이름 is a line giving 학파 of magic (and the subschool, if appropriate) that the spell belongs to.

Almost every spell belongs to one of eight 학파 of magic. A 학파 of magic is a group of related 주문 that work in similar ways. A small number of 주문(비전의 징표, 제한된 소원, 영구화, 요술, and 소원) are universal, belonging to no 학파.

회피술
Abjuration

회피술 are protective 주문. They create physical or magical barriers, negate magical or physical 능력, 해악 trespassers, or even banish the subject of the spell to another plane of existence.

If one 회피술 spell is active within 10 feet of another for 24 hours or more, the magical fields interfere with each other and create barely visible energy fluctuations. The DC to find such 주문 with 탐색 skill drops by 4.

If an 회피술 creates a barrier that keeps certain types of creatures at bay, that barrier cannot be used to push away those creatures. If you force the barrier against such a creature, you feel a discernible pressure against the barrier. If you continue to apply pressure, you end the spell.

소환술
Conjuration

Each 소환술 spell belongs to one of five subschools. 소환술 bring manifestations of objects, creatures, or some form of energy to you (the summoning subschool), actually 운송수단 creatures from another plane of existence to your plane (calling), 치료(치료), 운송수단 creatures or objects over great distances (teleportation), or 물체 생성 or effects on 감지(creation). Creatures you conjure usually, but not always, obey your 명령.

A creature or object brought into being or transported to your location by a 소환술 spell cannot appear inside another creature or object, nor can it appear floating in an empty space. It must arrive in an open location on a surface capable of supporting it.

The creature or object must appear within the spell’s 거리, but it does not have to remain within the 거리.

Calling: A calling spell 운송수단 a creature from another plane to the plane you are on. The spell grants the creature the one-time ability to return to its plane of origin, although the spell may limit the circumstances under which this is possible. Creatures who are called actually die when they are killed; they do not disappear and reform, as do those brought by a summoning spell (see below). 지속시간 of a calling spell is instantaneous, which means that the called creature can’t be dispelled.

Creation: A creation spell manipulates matter to create an object or creature in the place the spellcaster designates (subject to the limits noted above). If the spell has a 지속시간 other than instantaneous, magic holds the creation together, and when the spell ends, the conjured creature or object vanishes without a trace. If the spell has an instantaneous 지속시간, the created object or creature is merely assembled through magic. It lasts indefinitely and does not depend on magic for its existence.

치료: Certain 신성 소환술 치료 creatures or even bring them back to life.

Summoning: A summoning spell instantly brings a creature or object to a place you designate. When the spell ends or is dispelled, a summoned creature is instantly sent back to where it came from, but a summoned object is not sent back unless the spell 묘사 specifically indicates this. A summoned creature also goes away if it is killed or if its 히트 포인트 drop to 0 or lower. It is not really 죽음. It takes 24 hours for the creature to reform, during which time it can’t be summoned again.

When the spell that summoned a creature ends and the creature disappears, all 주문 it has cast expire. A summoned creature cannot use any innate summoning 능력 it may have, and it refuses to cast any 주문 that would cost it XP, or to use any spell-like 능력 that would cost XP if they were 주문.

Teleportation: A teleportation spell 운송수단 one or more creatures or objects a great distance. The most powerful of these 주문 can cross planar boundaries. Unlike summoning 주문, the transportation is (unless otherwise noted) one-way and not dispellable.

Teleportation is instantaneous travel through 영적 세계. Anything that blocks astral travel also blocks teleportation.

점술
Divination

점술 주문 enable you to learn secrets long forgotten, to predict the future, to find hidden things, and to foil deceptive 주문.

Many 점술 주문 have cone-shaped 범위. These 이동 with you and extend in the direction you look. The cone defines 범위 that you can sweep each round. If you study the same 범위 for multiple rounds, you can often gain additional information, as noted in 설명 문구 for the spell.

염탐: A 염탐 spell creates an invisible magical sensor that sends you information. Unless noted otherwise, the sensor has the same powers of sensory acuity that you possess. This 레벨 of acuity includes any 주문 or effects that target you, but not 주문 or effects that emanate from you. However, the sensor is treated as a separate, independent sensory organ of yours, and thus it functions normally even if you have been blinded, deafened, or otherwise suffered sensory impairment.

Any creature with an 지능 score of 12 or higher can notice the sensor by making a DC 20 지능 check. The sensor can be dispelled as if it were an active spell.

Lead sheeting or magical protection blocks a 염탐 spell, and you sense that the spell is so blocked.

부여술
Enchantment

부여술 주문 affect the minds of others, influencing or controlling their behavior.

All 부여술 are 정신영향계 주문. Two types of 부여술 주문 grant you influence over a subject creature.

Charm: A charm spell changes how the subject views you, typically making it see you as a good friend.

충동: A 충동 spell forces the subject to act in some manner or changes the way her mind works. Some 충동 주문 determine the subject’s actions or the effects on the subject, some 충동 주문 allow you to determine the subject’s actions when you cast the spell, and others give you ongoing control over the subject.

강신술
Evocation

강신술 주문 manipulate energy or tap an unseen source of power to produce a desired end. In effect, they create something out of nothing. Many of these 주문 produce spectacular effects, and 강신술 주문 can deal large amounts of 피해.

환영술
Illusion

환영술 주문 deceive the senses or minds of others. They cause people to see things that are not there, not see things that are there, hear phantom noises, or remember things that never happened.

Figment: A figment spell creates a false sensation. Those who perceive the figment perceive the same thing, not their own slightly different versions of the figment. (It is not a personalized mental impression.) Figments cannot make something seem to be something else. A figment that includes audible effects cannot duplicate intelligible speech unless the spell 묘사 specifically says it can. If intelligible speech is possible, it must be in a language you can 말하기. If you try to duplicate a language you cannot 말하기, the image produces gibberish. Likewise, you cannot make a visual copy of something unless you know what it looks like.

Because figments and glamers (see below) are unreal, they cannot produce real effects the way that other types of 환영술 can. They cannot cause 피해 to objects or creatures, support weight, provide nutrition, or provide protection from the elements. Consequently, these 주문 are useful for confounding or delaying foes, but useless for attacking them directly.

A figment’s AC is equal to 10 + its size 수정치.

Glamer: A glamer spell changes a subject’s sensory qualities, making it look, feel, taste, smell, or sound like something else, or even seem to disappear.

Pattern: Like a figment, a pattern spell creates an image that others can see, but a pattern also affects the minds of those who see it or are caught in it. All patterns are 정신영향계 주문.

Phantasm: A phantasm spell creates a mental image that usually only the caster and the subject (or subjects) of the spell can perceive. This impression is totally in the minds of the subjects. It is a personalized mental impression. (It’s all in their heads and not a fake picture or something that they actually see.) Third parties viewing or studying the scene don’t notice the phantasm. All phantasms are 마음에 영향을 미치는 주문.

어둠: A 어둠 spell creates something that is partially real from extradimensional energy. Such 환영술 can have real effects. 피해 dealt by a 어둠 환영술 is real.

내성 굴림 and 환영술(Disbelief ): Creatures encountering an 환영술 usually do not receive 내성 굴림 to recognize it as illusory until they study it carefully or interact with it in some fashion.

A successful 내성 굴림 against an 환영술 reveals it to be false, but a figment or phantasm remains as a translucent outline.

A failed 내성 굴림 indicates that a character fails to notice something is amiss. A character faced with proof that an 환영술 isn’t real needs no 내성 굴림. If any viewer successfully disbelieves an 환영술 and communicates this fact to others, each such viewer gains a 내성 굴림 with a +4 보너스.

강령술
Necromancy

강령술 주문 manipulate the power of death, unlife, and the life force. 주문 involving undead creatures make up a large part of this 학파.

변환술
Transmutation

변환술 주문 change the properties of some creature, thing, or condition.

[표지]

[DESCRIPTOR]

Appearing on the same line as 학파 and subschool, when applicable, is a descriptor that further categorizes the spell in some way. Some 주문 have more than one descriptor.

The descriptors are acid, air, chaotic, cold, 암흑, death, earth, electricity, evil, 공포, fire, force, good, language-dependent, lawful, 빛, 정신영향계, sonic, and water.

Most of these descriptors have no game effect by themselves, but they govern how the spell interacts with other 주문, with 특수 능력, with unusual creatures, with 성향, and so on.

A language-dependent spell uses intelligible language as a medium for communication. If the target cannot understand or cannot hear what the caster of a language-dependant spell says the spell fails.

A 정신영향계 spell works only against creatures with an 지능 score of 1 or higher.

레벨

LEVEL

The next line of a spell 묘사 gives the spell’s 레벨, a number between 0 and 9 that defines the spell’s relative power. To record an arcane spell in written form, a character uses complex notation that describes the magical forces involved in the spell. The writer uses the same system no matter what her native language or culture. However, each character uses the system in her own way. Another person’s magical writing remains incomprehensible to even the most powerful 마법사 until she takes time to study and decipher it.

If the skill check fails, the character cannot attempt to read that particular spell again until the next day. A 마법 읽기 spell automatically deciphers a magical writing without a skill check. If the person who created the magical writing is on hand to help the reader, success is also automatic.

Once a character deciphers a particular magical writing, she does not need to decipher it again. Deciphering a magical writing allows the reader to 식별 the spell and gives some idea of its effects (as explained in the spell 묘사). If the magical writing was a scroll and the reader can cast 비전 주문, she can attempt to use the scroll.

Writing a New Spell into a Spellbook

Once a 마법사 understands a new spell, she can record it into her spellbook.

Space in the Spellbook: A spell takes up one page of the spellbook per spell 레벨. Even a 0-레벨 spell (cantrip) takes one page. A spellbook has one hundred pages.

Note that a 마법사 does not have to pay these costs in time or gold for 주문 she gains for free at each new 레벨.

Replacing and Copying Spellbooks

A 마법사 can use the procedure for learning a spell to reconstruct a lost spellbook. If she already has a particular spell prepared, she can write it directly into a new book at a cost of 100 gp per page (as noted in Writing a New Spell into a Spellbook, above). The process wipes the prepared spell from her mind, just as casting it would. If she does not have the spell prepared, she can prepare it from a borrowed spellbook and then write it into a new book.

Duplicating an existing spellbook uses the same procedure as replacing it, but the task is much easier. The time requirement and cost per page are halved.
